text: John Francis Kane (September 24, 1882 in Chicago, Illinois – January 28, 1934 in St. Anthony, Idaho) was a professional baseball player who played outfielder in the Major Leagues from 1907 to 1910. He would play for the Chicago Cubs and Cincinnati Reds. In 261 games over four seasons, Kane posted a .220 batting average (181-for-824) with 118 runs, 7 home runs, 59 RBI, 53 stolen bases and 76 bases on balls. Defensively, he finished his career with an overall .952 fielding percentage playing at every position except pitcher, catcher and first base. Kane died in an automobile accident in St. Anthony, Idaho. ==External links== Category:1882 births Category:1934 deaths Category:Major League Baseball outfielders Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Cincinnati Reds players Category:Road incident deaths in Idaho Category:Minor league baseball managers Category:Pittsburg Coal Diggers players Category:Seattle Siwashes players Category:Vernon Tigers players Category:Venice Tigers players Category:Los Angeles Angels (minor league) players Category:Salt Lake City Bees players Category:San Francisco Seals (baseball) players Category:Sportspeople from Chicago Category:Baseball players from Illinois
title: John Kane (outfielder)
